modules.description: Provides operations to create, manipulate, and analyze strings, including concatenation, length calculation, case conversion, and iteration over Unicode code points. Works with a custom string type `t` and OCaml's standard string type. Used to process UTF-8 encoded text streams and perform case-insensitive comparisons.

Processes XML data using a streaming approach, supporting event-based parsing and generation of XML content. Works with input and output channels, as well as custom event handlers. Enables efficient handling of large XML files and real-time data processing.

Adds a Unicode code point to a buffer, clears its contents, and retrieves the current string or length. Operates on a buffer type and Unicode integers. Used to construct and manage UTF-8 encoded strings during XML parsing or generation.
